data.title: Gorgeous Building
data.text: The building is a gorgeous piece of architecture which an interesting history. A must visit for Hawaii Five-0 fans!

data.title: Stunnig Building
data.text: We used the free blue connect trolley for Outrigger Beach guests to do a city tour which stopped here for 15 minutes. Got some great photos of a stunning building and a broader perspective on the history of Honolulu. Great tour.

data.title: A must see
data.text: Early evening is best when viewing this statue and building, all the traffic will subside by then. Then come again in the evening and take great pictures...I've been told if u looking across the street at the palace u may see a ghost.

data.title: American royalty
data.text: I loved this place. The tour guide was full of interesting detail into the lives and motivations of the royal family. The palace was restored beautifully, uncovering hidden niches, beautiful carving, stained glass lights and the most modern of amenities of the day. The monarchs sought to have a democratic monarchy patterned after Great Britain. You will not be sorry to spend time hearing all about the family and seeing the restoration.

data.title: Top photogenic spot !
data.text: Great place for those classic photos , the king is very regal, truly dignified, the backdrop so impressive,

data.title: Beautiful statue and views
data.text: The architecture by here is really beautiful. The statue has some great history, and across the street is the palace. If you are going to go down in this area, I would recommend checking out both areas for some Hawaiian history.

data.title: If you are a fan of Hawaii Five -O, this is the place
data.text: So you get a kick out of watching Hawaii Five-O and you used to watch the original series?? Well, you will get a kick out of seeing the statue that is in the opening credits of Hawaii Five-O.  It will be worth a picture or two.  Parking can be a little bit tough.  And the signs say to stay off of the grass, but it will be worth it.  The building is open for tours and it is a working courthouse with interesting architecture and grounds.  It also has regular courthouse security with metal detectors at the door. This is directly across the street from Iolani Palace.

data.title: A look at how far Hawai'i has come, with a promise of a bright future!
data.text: It is rare that a state's highest court is also a repository of the state's culture and history, not only are cases ranging from land-use to civil rights argued here, but Hawai'i's greatest king is also memorialized in bronze!

data.title: Hawaii 5-0!!
data.text:
To be honest the only reason we stopped is because the family are big Hawaii 5-0 fans so how could we not get a picture in front of it!

Parking is very limited but we did find a spot in the lot to the left of the building.

data.title: Fairly interesting insight into the late 19th  and early 20th century royal Hawaiian family.
data.text: Visiting the royal palace provided some insight into the opulent lifestyle of the last Hawaiian dynasty.  Unfortunately I suspect that the docent gave a somewhat slanted view of the royal family painting them more as victims of white imperialism while playing down their obvious excesses at the probable expense of the islanders.

data.title: The "New" Hawaii 5-O Heaquarters ;-)
data.text:
5-O headquarters only on TV!
Ali'iōlani Hale was started in 1872 and completed two years later. Designed by Thomas Rowe, the building was originally going to be a palace and serve as the King's residence. But, this was changed and the building housed the Kingdom treasury, Supreme Court, and other government offices. Today, it continues to be the Hawai'i State Supreme Court. Tours free.

data.title: A Must For The 5-0 Fan
data.text: We were able to visit on Christmas Day. No traffic, parking up front, perfect! Although the facility was closed, we were able to walk around the building and check the landscape out. The old growth trees are amazing! So glad we made the stop!

data.title: Interesting Building
data.text: Of course everyone recognizes this from Hawaii Five-o television show. The building itself is interesting with some unusual architecture.

data.title: Think Hawaii 5-0!
data.text: Perhaps one of the most recognizable features of Oahu due to both the original series and the current as it is used in the opening credits. The building is architecturally beautiful.  Across the street from Iolani Palace.

data.title: Quick Stop By
data.text: My boyfriend & I watch Hawaii 5-0 so we thought we should stop by here. It was very quick maybe a 10 minute stop. We parked on the side of the road using meter parking. It was cool to see just because we watch the show, other than that nothing too too special. We didn't actually go in the building though.. looked busy. There was the Hawaii 5-0 film crew there so it was kind of busy! But still pretty cool!

data.title: Iconic building for Hawaii Five-0 fans
data.text: The history of Hawaiian law is explained here. The Supreme Court is actually in this building and it is still in operation. How they incorporate a museum and a court in the same building. Very informative.

data.title: Interesting Building
data.text: We visited Ali'iolani Hale as part of our city tour. Interesting building with a chance for several photo ops. A must for 5-0 fans.

data.title: Beautiful palace!! Be sure to stop in and see!
data.text: We didn't have much time to spend here but it is well worth taking a few minutes to see a key part of the history of Hawaii!

data.title: Iolani Palace
data.text: I was a little disappointed as we only had 15 min on the tour from Pearl Harbor. Would have liked to spend more time there. The statue of the King is what Hawaii 5O shows on there show.

data.title: A must for all 5-0 Fans
data.text: Forced family to go on trip to find this. Glad I did. King Kamehameha is right out front, and the court building is really very nice to look at. Get there early in the morning before workers and all the tour bus. Glad I went.
